# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/darwin-x64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/packaging/_structures.py
@source-hash: ab77953666d62461
@generated: 2026-02-09T17:59:39Z

## Purpose
Provides infinity value implementations for the packaging library's version comparison system. Implements positive and negative infinity singletons that behave correctly in comparison operations.

## Key Components

### InfinityType (L6-30)
Singleton class representing positive infinity in version comparisons:
- `__repr__()` (L7-8): Returns "Infinity" string representation
- `__hash__()` (L10-11): Hash based on string representation for set/dict usage
- Comparison operators (L13-26): Always returns False for `<`, `<=` and True for `>`, `>=`
- `__eq__()` (L19-20): Only equal to other InfinityType instances
- `__neg__()` (L28-29): Returns NegativeInfinity singleton when negated

### NegativeInfinityType (L35-59)
Singleton class representing negative infinity in version comparisons:
- `__repr__()` (L36-37): Returns "-Infinity" string representation  
- `__hash__()` (L39-40): Hash based on string representation
- Comparison operators (L42-55): Always returns True for `<`, `<=` and False for `>`, `>=`
- `__eq__()` (L48-49): Only equal to other NegativeInfinityType instances
- `__neg__()` (L57-58): Returns Infinity singleton when negated

### Singleton Instances
- `Infinity` (L32): Global InfinityType singleton instance
- `NegativeInfinity` (L61): Global NegativeInfinityType singleton instance

## Architectural Design
Uses singleton pattern to ensure unique infinity instances that can be safely compared with `is` operator. Both classes implement complete comparison protocol for proper sorting behavior in version ranges and constraints. The negation operators create a bidirectional relationship between positive and negative infinity.
